channel.title: Where'd it go?
channel.description:
Where'd the topic go posted by that autorune guy no more than 20 minutes ago, free rs membership...
he needs a ban.
tips for anyone who did try what he posted:
C:\users\<your username>\appdata\roaming\ (or C:\documents and settings\<your user>\application data\roaming if < vista)
in there you should find 2 directories, WindowsUpdate and install, you need to delete both of these (you may have to do it from another OS such as ubuntu live). then go to the startup tab in msconfig, you should find WindowsUpdate and HKCU(or something close to) in there, disable both of these and restart your pc.

I also copied it before it was deleted/moved, but if you got the pin line list…
[/quote]i do have the pin line list, but this doesn’t actually work does it?

throw the list my way >.>[/quote]
it’s on my linux partition, i’ll pm it to you when i’m next on it

Read full topic

item.title: Where'd it go?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:6, topic:338879”][quote author=Nueb35 link=topic=435267.msg3196361#msg3196361 date=1272830940]
so you’re saying it doesn’t work?
[/quote]
I didn’t get far enough to try it, but the voipcrack.exe IS a trojan.

I don’t think that’s deserving of a ban, it might have been a mistake. I didn’t try it yet, but I would assume the same could be done from any phone, though - voipzoom was just the one he had provided.

it wasn’t voipzoom that was the virus, it was the crack he provided with it, also if he didn’t do it knowingly, why did he remove the topic after I had posted that it was a virus on the topic?[/quote]

he didn’t remove the topic, i was under the impression that once some one posts a topic they cant remove it after someone replies.

someone had suggested it be moved to cm board, maybe it was?

Read full topic

@eczema3 wrote:

so you’re saying it doesn’t work?

I didn’t get far enough to try it, but the voipcrack.exe IS a trojan.

cooper:

I don’t think that’s deserving of a ban, it might have been a mistake. I didn’t try it yet, but I would assume the same could be done from any phone, though - voipzoom was just the one he had provided.

it wasn’t voipzoom that was the virus, it was the crack he provided with it, also if he didn’t do it knowingly, why did he remove the topic after I had posted that it was a virus on the topic?

item.title: Where'd it go?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Also a handy tool for finding it is process explorer

docs.microsoft.com

Process Explorer - Windows Sysinternals

Find out what files, registry keys and other objects processes have open, which DLLs they have loaded, and more.

it showed a process called server.exe (located in the install directory previously mentioned) which when killed would spawn another process of itself, which then spawned another process of itself which renamed itself to one of your currently running applications, thus hiding itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Where'd it go?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

This is correct, I ran it in a sandbox first.

Also, it is easiest just to turn off your computer and run it in safe-mode to delete these files.

Read full topic
